metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9794 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
Race condition in the snd_pcm_period_elapsed function insound/core/pcm_lib.c in the ALSA subsystem in the Linux kernel before 4.7allows local users to cause a denial of service (use-after-free) orpossibly have unspecified other impact via a craftedSNDRV_PCM_TRIGGER_START command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-59-generic - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-4.4.0-59-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-4.4.0-59-lowlatency - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-4.4.0-59-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-4.4.0-59-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-4.4.0-59-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-4.4.0-59-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-59.80
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-59-generic - 4.4.0-59.80
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1040-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1040.47
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1044-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1044.48
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-aws - 4.4.0-1003.12
No subscription required

linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-generic-lpae - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-4.8.0-36-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.8.0-36-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-59.80').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1040.47').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1044.48').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.12').
linux-hwe package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
